problem.p: A bowl full of sand rests on a frictionless surface. A spinning disc is dropped onto the sand. Eventually the bowl, sand, and disk are spinning at the same rate.
Which of the following statements are true for the system of disc, bowl, and sand?
My answer to part 1 is justified because:

choicegroup.choice: Friction removes mechanical energy from the system.
Objects naturally lose energy as time goes on.
Friction provides the same torque on the sand and the disc.
All the torques in this problem are internal to the system of disc, bowl, and sand.
